most_active_tickets.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
I'm unable to do Handshake with asana
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
Visual Studio 2022 extension interfering with Diagnostic tool output
Copilot is not giving any feedback
Bug: unable to cancel the download of an LLLM

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop and Copilot not responding after update
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop and Copilot become unresponsive after updating to recent versions on Windows and Linux. Issues include app failing to launch, getting stuck during loading, and Copilot not responding in conversations. Troubleshooting steps like restarting, reinstalling, and checking logs haven't resolved the problems. Some users observe partial functionality like conversation summaries updating despite unresponsiveness.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Copilot not responding
related_issues.text:
Copilot not responding
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS: 11.3.3 - Pieces for Developers: 4.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey all,
Pieces Copilot no longer responds in conversations in the app, or through any of the extensions (VS Code/Chrome). It just keeps loading. I've tried hard-resetting, restarting, reinstalling, On-Device LLMs, and Cloud LLMs. The weird thing is, some of the conversations will have a summary or will update the name of the conversation, but it never responds in the chat. I looked at the logs and saw repeated Sentry Event Errors, but not sure what to do with that.  I attached the log file from the day before yesterday (yesterday's is too large and won't upload). What should I do?

Thanks!

[log-04292025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19997109/log-04292025.txt)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Integrations Failing
common_issues.description: Users report various failures across Pieces OS and integrations like Asana and Copilot. Issues include Handshake failures with Asana, login failures with a 500 error on /os/sign_in, and Copilot unresponsiveness despite conversation summaries updating.  Suggested troubleshooting includes checking logs for errors, ensuring valid model versions, and verifying network connectivity.

related_issues.title: I'm unable to do Handshake with asana
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.038635  0:00:00.001700 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.043187  0:00:00.000732 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.335453  0:00:00.001876 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:56.077590  0:00:00.000695 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces for Windows: Extension and App Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces for Windows extensions and apps malfunctioning. Issues include Visual Studio's diagnostic tools pane blanking with Pieces plugin enabled, Pieces Copilot unresponsiveness in conversations, and Pieces Desktop app failing to launch past "Ensure Core Dependencies" stage.  Troubleshooting steps like reinstalling, restarting, and checking logs have been attempted.  Issues span Pieces OS versions 11.2.0 and 11.3.3, and Pieces for Developers 4.1.1.

related_issues.title: Visual Studio 2022 extension interfering with Diagnostic tool output
related_issues.text: Visual Studio 2022 extension interfering with Diagnostic tool output ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Visual Studio ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version PiecesOS 11.3.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. The Diagnostic tools pane that, by default, opens when you begin debugging in Visual Studio ends up entirely blank with the Pieces plugin enabled in Visual Studio Version 17.14.0 Preview 4.0. Disabling the plugin restores the Diagnostic tools output. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop fails to launch or connect to Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop application failing to launch or connect to Pieces OS across different operating systems (Windows, Linux). Issues include "Invalid port" errors, indefinite loading at the "Verify Dependency Connections" step, and HTTP 500 errors during login.  Suggested solutions include checking Pieces OS port configuration, reinstalling Pieces Desktop, and verifying Pieces OS is running correctly.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Local and Cloud LLM Model Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with both locally hosted and cloud-based LLMs.  Symptoms include failure to install local models, Copilot unresponsiveness, and continuous loading.  A common error message points to a 404 for the Gemini Pro model.  Suggested solutions include checking model validity and project access.

Hey all,
Pieces Copilot no longer responds in conversations in the app, or through any of the extensions (VS Code/Chrome). It just keeps loading. I've tried hard-resetting, restarting, reinstalling, On-Device LLMs, and Cloud LLMs. The weird thing is, some of the conversations will have a summary or will update the name of the conversation, but it never responds in the chat. I looked at the logs and saw repeated Sentry Event Errors, but not sure what to do with that.  I attached the log file from the day before yesterday (yesterday's is too large and won't upload). What should I do?

Thanks!

[log-04292025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19997109/log-04292025.txt)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. recommendations: Prioritize resolving the 'Pieces Desktop and Copilot not responding after update' issue, given its high frequency and impact on users.
Investigate the root cause of the 'Pieces OS and Integrations Failing' issue, focusing on Handshake failures with Asana and login failures with a 500 error.
Address the 'Pieces for Windows: Extension and App Functionality Issues' to ensure compatibility and stability across the Windows ecosystem.
Provide clear guidance and documentation on installing and troubleshooting local and cloud LLM models.
Improve communication with users regarding ongoing issues and expected resolution timelines.
Enhance error logging and reporting to facilitate faster identification and resolution of problems.
Proactively monitor system performance and stability to prevent future issues.
Consider implementing automated testing to catch compatibility and functionality issues earlier in the development cycle.
Gather user feedback on specific pain points and areas for improvement in the support process itself.
Prioritize tickets based on activity level and user impact to ensure timely resolution of critical issues.
Create a dedicated support channel for EAP users to address issues specific to pre-release versions.
Develop a knowledge base or FAQ section to address common issues and troubleshooting steps.
Investigate the feasibility of self-service tools for common support requests.
Analyze support ticket trends to identify recurring issues and areas for product improvement.
Regularly review and update support documentation to reflect the latest product changes and troubleshooting steps.
Train support staff on common issues and best practices for troubleshooting.
Implement a system for tracking and prioritizing bug fixes based on user impact and frequency.
Improve the process for escalating complex issues to the development team.
Foster closer collaboration between support and development teams to streamline issue resolution.
Encourage users to provide detailed bug reports with steps to reproduce the issue.
Implement a system for collecting user feedback on the support experience.
Analyze user feedback to identify areas for improvement in the support process.
Regularly review and update support processes and procedures to ensure efficiency and effectiveness.
Provide support staff with the necessary tools and resources to effectively address user issues.
Empower support staff to take ownership of user issues and drive them to resolution.
Recognize and reward support staff for exceptional performance and contributions.
